alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 7:27AM EDT until July 14 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey... South central Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... * Until 745 AM EDT. * At 726 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lake Telemark to near Boonton to Caldwell, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hopatcong, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Mount Arlington, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Pequannock Township, Lake Telemark, Green Pond and White Meadow Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 45 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 44 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
